Key Match Events: Stephen Curry made a high arching fadeaway from the baseline with 1.1 second remaining in the first half, giving the Warriors a seven-point lead at halftime.
Buddy Hield's shot extended the Warrior lead to 15 and capped a 38-point quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors won their fourth consecutive game at Chase Center, improving to 4-1 at home.
The Warriors have won three consecutive games vs. the Grizzlies overall.
Tonight marked the first of four games for the Warriors vs. the Grizzlies this season, with their next matchup on 12/19 at MEM.
The Warriors improved to 8-0 when scoring 120-plus points.
The Warriors improved to 6-1 when dishing out 30-plus assists.
The Warriors improved to 6-0 when grabbing 50-or-more rebounds.
Tonight marked the Warriors’ 523rd consecutive sellout, the third longest active streak in the NBA.
Others: Draymond Green shot 3-for-7 from deep against the Grizzlies, marking his third game with three treys this season.
Kyle Anderson returned to action after missing the last game due to a right neck spasm and recorded eight points, four rebounds, four assists, and two blocks in 19 minutes off the bench.
De’Anthony Melton missed tonight’s game due to a left ACL sprain.
Lindy Waters III suffered a left knee hyperextension with 1:58 left in the second quarter and did not return.
